page.title: 05TRINITY HOUSE SCHOOL HULL
page.content: Near the Marina is a cream painted archway leading to a courtyard in which there is the mast of an old sailing ship. This is Trinity House home of the Hull Trinity House set up about 600 years ago. Originally a religious foundation, it took care of sailors and their families but since the 17th century it has looked after the lights and buoys on the Humber and licenced the rivers Pilots. The school is for boys only and offers a singular curriculum which includes navigation,signaling and sailing together with the traditional subjects as well. The pupils are chosen by entrance exam and about 90 are picked each year from 250. The boys are known as Cadets and they are allowed to wear Merchant Naval uniform. The schools motto 'SPES SUPER SYDERA', or Look Beyond the Stars.
